titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Texas Music Collection
titlestmt.author: Alison Clemens

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoded in EAD by Archon 3.21 from an SQL database source on October 17th, 2016.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Texas Music Collection 1900/2010

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: The Texas Music Collection contains research files on the history of Texas music, particularly musicians and record labels, including the administrative and financial files of Duke/Peacock records, of the Houston area. Newspaper clippings, photographs, financial records, songbooks, and administrative files comprise the research files.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: Andrew Brown is a Texas music historian who primarily writes biographies and histories of music artists and record labels for books, magazines, and album liner notes. Brown has also conducted interviews for major Texas music figures, including Huey Meaux.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

controlaccess.head: Topical Term:
controlaccess.subject: Music -- Texas -- History and criticism
Musicians -- Texas
Popular music -- Texas -- History and criticism

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Reproduction decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Texas Music Collection. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials:
relatedmaterial.p: Duke-Peacock Records Publicity Photos and ACA Master Books digital collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Texas Music Collection contains research files on the history of Texas music, particularly musicians and record labels, including the administrative and financial files of Duke/Peacock records, of the Houston area. Newspaper clippings, photographs, financial records, songbooks, and administrative files comprise the research files.

The collection is divided into six series, which are arranged in order of volume of material, from most to least represented: I. Artists, II. Production and Events, III. Geography, IV. Genres, V. Reference, and VI. Ephemera. The Production and Events series is further divided into five subseries: 1. Labels and Studios, 2. Radio, 3. Producers, 4. Venues, and 5. Record Shops.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Artists series contains files on various Texas music artists and typically contains biographical information and materials documenting their recording careers. Formats represented in this series include photographs, correspondence, newspaper clippings, and promotional materials.

did.unittitle: Christian, Ben and His Texas Cowboys
Crawford, Blackie and the Western Cherokees
Freeman, Bill and the Texas Plainsmen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Production and Events series comprises a range of material documenting the production of Texas music and is further divided into subseries pertaining to: Labels and Studios, Radio Stations, Producers, Venues, and Record Shops.

did.unittitle: Meaux, Huey - Huey P. Meaux and Charlie Booth vs. The United States of America

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Geographic series contains files on major regions in Texas music. Photographs and printed material, especially newspaper clippings and newsletters, comprise the majority of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Genres series contains files on Texas Rock and Zydeco music. Printed material, correspondence, and photographs comprise the bulk of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Reference series includes printed material, such as magazines and directories, used by Andrew Brown for his research on Texas Music. The music historian Mack McCormick also has a file in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Ephemera series contains oversize publication and promotional materials and photographs from the research files.
